column4: Hello Pleople.  I've just tried to compile and install a new kernel (2.6.16.11).  When I try to load it I get an error like this: http://i72.photobucket.com/albums/i199/jhartzen/kernel_err.jpg
this is a wild guess: if you have SATA, change your hd device entries from hda to sda or vice versa.
.... I jsut copied the entry for the currently working kernel, and change the file name to point to the new image
do you use a root= parameter?
yes indeed, it looks liek this: kernel          /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.16.11 root=/dev/sda1 ro quiet splash
change it to root=/dev/hda1 and try again.
> I am willing to try that but like I said:  This is a copy of the entry for my current kernel, with only the image file name different, so it doesn't make a whole lot of sense to me.
take my advice or leave it. It's up to you.
